questions.text: How did Carla test the woman to see if she was good enough to take care of Carla's children?
questions.correct: Carla had the woman hit her.
options: Carla gave her and IQ test.
Carla asked her if she knew karate.
questions.explanation:
Carla had the woman hit her.

	Carla's children were known for their bad behaviors. In a previous episode Sam described her children as "chainsaws with feet".

questions.text: Who was the Red Sox player that came to Sam for help?
questions.explanation:
Rick Walker.

	Rick Warner was played by Christopher McDonald. He was born February 15, 1955 in NYC. He has acted in at least 85 films as well as television and theatre productions.

questions.text: What did the patrons do when the baseball player came in?
questions.explanation:
Booed him.

	Rick Walker's slump had all the Red Sox fans upset with him. Carla mentioned that before he came to the Sox he was unbeatable.

questions.text: What did Diane say the player needed?
questions.explanation:
Meditation.

	Diane told Sam that Rick should try meditation. Sam laughed at her, figuring she knew nothing about baseball.

questions.text: What did Coach say the player needed to do?
questions.explanation:
Beef up his sex life.

	Diane tried to get Rick to meditate with her and he thought she was talking about having sex. Diane ended up slapping him.

questions.text: What superstition did Sam say he had?
questions.correct: He never pitched to anyone named Reggie, Willie, or The Bull.
options: He never pitched to someone more attractive than himself.
He never pitched on a cloudy day.
He never pitched to anyone taller than himself.
questions.explanation:
He never pitched to anyone named Reggie, Willie, or The Bull.

	Rick asked him about his superstitions because he was trying to find something that would help him pitch better. Sam then told him about his lucky charm.

a bottle cap.

	Sam still had his lucky charm. He told Rick that it didn't have to be his lucky charm, that anything could work.

questions.text: How many games did Coach say Sam won with his lucky charm?
questions.explanation:
0.

	Coach told Diane that Sam's lucky charm had nothing to do with baseball. This got Diane's curiosity up. Coach said she could ask one question. She asked, "Only one?", which Coach considered the one question.

questions.text: What happened to the lucky charm?
options: The player returned it to Sam
The player gave it away to another player.
questions.explanation:
The player lost it.

	Sam started having all sort of bad things happening to him and finally called Rick to get the lucky charm back. When he called Rick, Rick said he lost it somewhere in Kansas City.

questions.text: Why was the charm so important to Sam?
questions.correct: It was the cap off the last alcoholic drink he ever had.
options: It was a rare bottle cap that went to his bottle cap collection.
His mother gave it to him.
His first love gave it to him.
questions.explanation:
It was the cap off the last alcoholic drink he ever had.

	Sam told Diane that he really wanted to drink. Diane offered to get drunk for him. When Sam poured his beer he ended up giving it to Diane, saying perhaps he gave away the wrong bottle cap.
